title: [FR] Allow passing pathlib.Path to set_tracking_uri

labels.name: area/tracking
labels.description: Tracking service, tracking client APIs, autologging

body:
### Willingness to contribute

Yes. I can contribute this feature independently.

### Proposal Summary

It would be intuitive that we could pass the standard library's paths object to `set_tracking_uri`.

It's also easy to implement, we just have to call `path.as_uri()`.

I assume there is other places where the user can pass an uri, would be nice if the behavior could be uniform across the API.

### Motivation

#### What is the use case for this feature?

```python
from pathlib import Path
path = Path("foo/bar")
mlflow.set_tracking_uri(path / "baz")
mlflow.start_run()
```

currently outputs:

```
AttributeError: 'PosixPath' object has no attribute 'decode'
```

#### Why is this use case valuable to support for MLflow users in general?

It's intuitive that this would work.

#### Why is this use case valuable to support for your project(s) or organization?

Our team has some standard path stored in `Path` instead of strings (e.g a standard path to store mlflow results).

#### Why is it currently difficult to achieve this use case?

It's not, but it is confusing that it isn't supported

_No response_
